poem:
### Transatlantic Echoes

Britons murmur in distant tones,  
unseen tapestry of tales—  
Trump, a shadow cast, unknown,  
breath of Farage,  
stirring old winds anew.  
Powell returns from past whispers,  
like autumn leaves sighed,  
waiting. Lammy speaks  
in layers, the world tilts,  
where knowing  
never quite meets the knowing.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "British voters do not like Trump ‘because they don’t really know him’, Farage claims – as it happened 5.45pm GMT Afternoon summary Jonathan Powell, the former chief of staff to Tony Blair, has been appointed as Keir Starmer’s new national security adviser in a further sign that important figures from the New Labour era are returning to the government. David Lammy, the foreign secretary, has said that Donald Trump “didn’t seem to think it mattered”,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: British voters do not like Trump ‘because they don’t really know him’, Farage claims – as it happened 5.45pm GMT Afternoon summary Jonathan Powell, the former chief of staff to Tony Blair, has been appointed as Keir Starmer’s new national security adviser in a further sign that important figures from the New Labour era are returning to the government. David Lammy, the foreign secretary, has said that Donald Trump “didn’t seem to think it mattered”,
